messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Martial arts
messages.msgSnippet: Hi you may be best going to www.e-budo.com with this one, they are more organised for this sort fo thing paul ... I have one question on martial artists in a
messages.messageBody:
Hi

you may be best going to www.e-budo.com with this one,
they are more organised for this sort fo thing

paul


--- Lee Changsub <knorr31@...> wrote:

---------------------------------
I have one question on martial artists in a group. A
year ago, I injured my left knee cartridge by a moving
car. Since then, I had a surgery and rehab only after
six months later due to my workload.
I want to resume my training especially with kick
movements.
What is the best way or safe way to do so without
reinjuring myself. My favorite skill was 540 degree
jump kick. I am very dynamic in nature.

I will appreciate if you give any advice or personal
experience with this type of injury. Thank you.





Sincerely,






Changsub Lee

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Martial arts
messages.msgSnippet: Changsub- I am currently doing rehab for a torn meniscus. The number one thing to avoid is high impact. Kicking is fine,  just dont contact anything until you
messages.messageBody:
Changsub-
I am currently doing rehab for a torn meniscus. The number one thing
to avoid is high impact. Kicking is fine, just dont contact anything
until you are well past 100% recovered...
-t

messages.subject: Re: [samuraihistory] Martial arts
messages.msgSnippet: Hope it servs as reference General kyudo  a bow and arrow jarijutsun spear kenjutsu  way of the sword jobatjutsu  arrow shooting in horse riding tantojutsu
messages.messageBody:
Hope it servs as reference

General
kyudo a bow and arrow
jarijutsun spear
kenjutsu way of the sword
jobatjutsu arrow shooting in horse riding
tantojutsu trowing short sword( long knife)
tachioyogi swiming full armored
jojutsu and bojutsu long and medium long stick

non armed combat technics

old Bujutsu (tendori, tegiki,koshi mawari, yawara, torite,hakuda wajutsu shubaku)

jujutsu
daito ryu aiki jujutsu( Takeda clan) easter great style particualr to this clan

martial arts school ( styles)
takenouchi ryu
sekiguchi ryu
shinkage ryu
kyushin ryu
tenji shinyo ryu
daito ryu
yagyu ryu
amomg teh principals

modern times original derivation form the old schools and founded by real samurai clan member

Daito ryu aikijujutsu ( Takeda sogaku Sensei)
Aikido ( Morihei Oueshiba O sensei)

sean_03809 <sean_03809@...> wrote:
Hello,

What type of martial arts did they learn? What is the modern
type called? Thanks.

Sean
